newsitem.title: UK: Yahoo! Europe to raise advertising rates.
newsitem.headline: Yahoo! Europe to raise advertising rates.

text.p: Yahoo! Europe, an Internet search and navigation company, will increase its advertising rates in September because of strong demand, marketing director Iain Osborne said.

Demand in categories of business, economics, news and computers is particularly strong, Osborne told Reuters in a phone interview on Thursday. "In those categories demand is greater than inventory," he said.
Yahoo! Europe is a subsidiary of U.S.-based Yahoo Inc.
Despite the rate increase, Osborne said Internet advertising remains in its infancy, with Internet advertising in Europe lagging the United States by about 18 months.
Osborne called the current market "smaller than a grain of sand. You can bleed trying to sell advertising on the Internet," he said.
Sound auditing of Web site traffic on the Internet is still needed to give providers such as Yahoo! the data to present to potential advertisers, he said.

Certain industries in Europe, including financial services, automotive and travel, are already sophisticated Internet advertisers, and the business-to-business sector is also active. "Consumer products is just starting," Osborne said.
Yahoo! Europe said two separate studies show that Yahoo! Germany is the most widely used navigational guide in Germany and Yahoo! France is that country's most widely used World Wide Web site.
